intro: Mormodes wageneriana, commonly known as the Wagner's mormode, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
